metadata.description: Code values and column explanations from production queries + systematic column value research
metadata.source: SQL_Examples folder bootstrap analysis + overdraft query learning + EDWBLU01600_VP column value research queries + SQL INFO.xlsx query results (39 sheets) + EDWAML.xlsx (40 sheets) + EDWAcc.xlsx (55 sheets) + EDWFKS.xlsx (23 sheets)

actv_.usage: Standard filter for current accounts - 63.5% of all accounts

sttl_.usage: Historical or closed accounts - 36.5% of all accounts

AR_LCS_TP_CL.trap: Use code version (_CL) for filtering, name version (_NM) for display

aliv_.usage: Filter for currently active legal entities

AC_AR_X_IP_TP_CL.description: Account to interested party type classification
AC_AR_X_IP_TP_CL.common_pattern: Use IN ('prow_', 'ownr_') to get all owners

IP_TP_CL.notes: Basic customer type distinction. Values: indv_ (individual), orgn_ (organization), orun_ (organizational unit), notfn (not found)

notfn.usage: Special cases where type not determined

ELC_ADR_TP_CL.common_pattern: Use IN clause to get all contact types

EXT_PD_F.why_important: Critical filter - without it, reports include internal accounts
EXT_PD_F.default_filter: Almost always filter WHERE EXT_PD_F = 'Y' for customer reports

LGL_CMPNC_ST_TP_CL.trap: Empty string means business, non-empty means private

AR_TP_CL.description: Account/Arrangement type classification - PRIMARY account type filter

dpar_.usage: Standard deposit/savings accounts - most common type (38%)

AR_TP_CL.notes: 244 total distinct account types - top 10 shown above represent 93% of all accounts

1835260.usage: Credit risk ratings for general population
1835260.WARNING: Does NOT contain RKI customer credit ratings - use 2112364 for RKI

2112364.usage: Credit risk ratings specifically for RKI customers

'1'.meaning: Kunder med OIV (Customers with value impairment)
'1'.business_context: Customers where bank has recognized impairment or calculations indicate impairment needed

'2a'.meaning: Normal credit rating - low probability of non-performance

'2b'.meaning: Some weakness - doesn't meet 2a criteria but no significant weakness

'2c'.meaning: Significant weakness - no objective impairment indication

2112364.common_mistake: Using numeric value 1 instead of string '1' - will return 0 rows
2112364.join_pattern: JOIN RATING t2 ON t1.GRP_ID = t2.GRP_ID AND t1.RATING_ID = t2.RATING_ID

GRP_ID.trap: Same column name, completely different meanings in different tables AND different GRP_ID values mean different rating scales

SNPST_DT.trap: Forgetting this in joins causes Cartesian product of all snapshots

DRVD_CST_IDENTN_NO.notes: Use this for customer joins, not IP_ID (which is internal)

IP_ID.notes: Use for table joins, but display DRVD_CST_IDENTN_NO in results
IP_ID.sql_example: JOIN CST t2 ON t1.IP_ID = t2.IP_ID

AR_ID.notes: Use for joins; AC_AR_NO is customer-facing account number
AR_ID.sql_example: JOIN AC_AR_BAL t3 ON t1.AR_ID = t3.AR_ID

PRIM_OWN_ID.usage: Link account to primary owner (references CST.IP_ID)
PRIM_OWN_ID.notes: For multi-party accounts, use AC_AR_X_IP instead

critical_overdraft_usage.description: Primary owner's IP_ID for the account - prevents double-counting in group aggregations
business_logic: Each account has one PRIM_OWN_ID even if multiple co-owners exist
Use this to link accounts to customers instead of AC_AR_X_IP for overdraft calculations
Ensures each account's overdraft is counted exactly once per day
critical_rules: ALWAYS join via PRIM_OWN_ID for risk group overdraft aggregations
Do NOT use AC_AR_X_IP join for overdraft summation (causes duplicates)
Some customers in a risk group may be co-owners but not primary owners - their overdrafts are correctly attributed to the PRIM_OWN_ID
critical_overdraft_usage.example: JOIN AC_AR_OD_INF_DLY od ON c.IP_ID = od.PRIM_OWN_ID AND c.LDB_ID = od.LDB_ID

LDB_ID.meaning: Identifies which legal database entity the record belongs to
LDB_ID.CRITICAL_BUG_WARNING: Using QUALIFY ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY IP_ID ORDER BY LDB_ID DESC) without filtering to LDB_ID = 1600 will select LDB_ID = 1 for some customers, causing join failures downstream
critical_filtering_rule: ALWAYS add 'AND c.LDB_ID = 1600' to WHERE clause BEFORE the QUALIFY statement
Some customers may have records in LDB_ID = 1 AND LDB_ID = 1600
ORDER BY LDB_ID DESC will pick LDB_ID = 1 (wrong), not 1600 (correct)
All operational data (AC_AR_OD_INF_DLY, AC_AR_BAL) exists in LDB_ID = 1600
Without explicit LDB_ID = 1600 filter, entire risk groups will silently disappear from results
LDB_ID.usage: Required filter and join key for cross-table operations
LDB_ID.bug_symptom: Risk groups with valid overdraft data missing from final output because CST selected LDB_ID = 1 but overdraft data has LDB_ID = 1600, causing join condition 'rep.LDB_ID = m.LDB_ID' to fail (1 ≠ 1600)
LDB_ID.correct_pattern: WHERE c.SNPST_DT = max_date AND c.LDB_ID = 1600 QUALIFY ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY c.IP_ID ORDER BY c.LDB_ID DESC) = 1
LDB_ID.wrong_pattern: WHERE c.SNPST_DT = max_date QUALIFY ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY c.IP_ID ORDER BY c.LDB_ID DESC) = 1  -- BUG: Will select LDB_ID = 1 for some customers
LDB_ID.join_example: JOIN AC_AR_OD_INF_DLY od ON c.IP_ID = od.PRIM_OWN_ID AND c.LDB_ID = od.LDB_ID
LDB_ID.trap: Forgetting to filter on LDB_ID = 1600 before joining can cause join failures or incorrect results

EOD_BAL_AMT.meaning: Net balance (can be positive or negative)

OD_ORIG_AMT.description: Original overdraft amount in original currency - AUTHORITATIVE source for overdraft calculations
business_logic: This is the correct column for overdraft summation and aggregation
Always negative when account is in overdraft, zero when no overdraft
Preferred over AC_AR_BAL.OD_AMT for accurate overdraft reporting
critical_usage_rules: ALWAYS use this for overdraft calculations instead of AC_AR_BAL.OD_AMT
Filter with WHERE OD_ORIG_AMT < 0 to get only overdraft records
Sum defensively using: SUM(CASE WHEN OD_ORIG_AMT < 0 THEN OD_ORIG_AMT ELSE 0 END)
related_columns: PRIM_OWN_ID: Primary owner IP_ID - use for customer linkage to prevent double-counting
OD_ORIG_AMT.sql_example: SUM(CASE WHEN OD_ORIG_AMT < 0 THEN OD_ORIG_AMT ELSE 0 END) AS TOTAL_OVERDRAFT

Anfordring.usage: Demand deposit/on-call account - most common product

SSA_CD.notes: SSA_CD is typically 'KERNE' (core), actual product type is in SSA_PD_NM
SSA_CD.critical_usage: Use SSA_PD_NM for filtering by product type, not SSA_CD

EFF_DT.common_pattern: WHERE CURRENT_DATE BETWEEN EFF_DT AND END_DT

END_DT.common_pattern: WHERE CURRENT_DATE BETWEEN EFF_DT AND END_DT

_CL suffix.usage: Short code value (4-5 chars, often ends with underscore)

CST_EXT_RKI_INF.description: RKI customer external information - INDEPENDENT table, not a child of CST
CST_EXT_RKI_INF.critical_architecture_note: This is a SEPARATE table with its own 9-column primary key, NOT hierarchically related to CST
CST_EXT_RKI_INF.common_mistake: Joining CST → CST_EXT_RKI_INF will fail because they are independent tables
CST_EXT_RKI_INF.correct_approach: Start FROM CST_EXT_RKI_INF directly, then join to AC_AR and other tables

EXT_RKI_DEL_DT.usage: Filter with IS NULL to get active RKI registrations

correct_join_path_for_rki_queries: JOIN AC_AR ON IP_ID + SNPST_DT (to get loans)
No CST table needed - RKI table already contains customer info
CST_EXT_RKI_INF.sql_example: SELECT * FROM EDWBLU01600_VP.CST_EXT_RKI_INF t1 WHERE t1.EXT_RKI_DEL_DT IS NULL AND t1.SNPST_DT = (SELECT MAX(SNPST_DT) FROM EDWBLU01600_VP.DT)

CST_RKI_ST.usage: Alternative source for RKI status information

values.sql_example: WHERE BAL_USG_TP_CL IS NULL OR BAL_USG_TP_CL = ''

BAL_USG_TP_CL.notes: Most accounts don't have specific balance usage classification. When present, primarily distinguishes consumer vs business

values.meaning: Not a loan / No loan classification
values.sql_example: WHERE LOAN_TP_CL IS NULL OR LOAN_TP_CL = ''

LOAN_TP_CL.notes: Only populated for loan accounts. Most accounts have AR_TP_CL = 'loan_' but LOAN_TP_CL may still be null
LOAN_TP_CL.trap: Don't rely on LOAN_TP_CL alone to identify loans - use AR_TP_CL = 'loan_' instead

values.sql_example: WHERE (GND_CL IS NULL OR GND_CL = '') AND IP_TP_CL = 'indv_'

ORG_TP_CL.description: Organization type classification for business customers

none_.meaning: No specific organization type / general organization

ovsb_.meaning: Organization type SB (possibly: Småvirksomhed / Small business)

values.sql_example: WHERE (ORG_TP_CL IS NULL OR ORG_TP_CL = '') AND IP_TP_CL = 'orgn_'

ORG_TP_CL.notes: 24 distinct organization types in total - top 5 shown represent 98% of organizations

EMP_TP_CL.description: Employment type classification for individual customers

unkn_.usage: 54.6% of individuals - employment status not captured

values.sql_example: WHERE (EMP_TP_CL IS NULL OR EMP_TP_CL = '') AND IP_TP_CL = 'indv_'

EMP_TP_CL.notes: 12 total employment types. 90% of customers have unkn_ or null - suggests field not consistently populated
EMP_TP_CL.data_quality_note: High percentage of unknown/null values suggests limited reliability for credit decisioning

IDV_MAR_ST_TP_CL.notes: 7 distinct marital statuses. 75% unknown suggests optional/incomplete data capture
IDV_MAR_ST_TP_CL.data_quality_note: High percentage of unknown values - use with caution

values.sql_example: WHERE EMRGTN_STATUS_TP_CL IS NULL OR EMRGTN_STATUS_TP_CL = ''

EMRGTN_STATUS_TP_CL.notes: Binary classification - most customers are residents. Important for compliance and tax purposes
EMRGTN_STATUS_TP_CL.business_context: Emigrated status may affect account servicing, taxation, and regulatory reporting

dprc_.usage: Write-down repayment method - 51.8% of repayment arrangements

REPYMT_TP_CL.notes: Nearly even split between write-down and installment methods. Principal-only is very rare

REPYMT_FRQ_CL.notes: 11 total frequencies. 96% are either monthly or one-time. eo_ prefix = 'end of' period, ev_ prefix = 'every' period
REPYMT_FRQ_CL.pattern_explanation: eo_ = end-of-period (ultimo), ev_ = every period, onon_ = one-time only

CST_MRK_F.description: Customer marketing flag - indicates if account is eligible for marketing
CST_MRK_F.notes: Very few accounts flagged for marketing - likely opt-in only. Filter WHERE CST_MRK_F = 'Y' for marketing campaigns
CST_MRK_F.business_context: GDPR compliance - only accounts with explicit marketing consent should have Y

INT_CLNG_F.description: Interest ceiling flag - indicates if account has interest rate cap/ceiling

values.sql_example: WHERE INT_CLNG_F IS NULL OR INT_CLNG_F = ''

INT_CLNG_F.notes: No accounts have Y value. Either null or explicitly N. Likely legacy field or prepared for future use
INT_CLNG_F.trap: No positive (ceiling exists) cases found in data - field may not be actively used

FIX_CR_INT_F.description: Fixed credit interest flag - indicates fixed rate for credit interest

values.meaning: Not applicable / No fixed credit interest
values.sql_example: WHERE FIX_CR_INT_F IS NULL OR FIX_CR_INT_F = ''

X.usage: 4 accounts with X value - investigate further

FIX_CR_INT_F.notes: Nearly all null. 4 accounts have X (not Y/N). Likely inactive field or special edge cases
FIX_CR_INT_F.trap: Unusual to have 'X' instead of 'Y' - may indicate data quality issue or special status
FIX_CR_INT_F.data_quality_note: Consider investigating the 4 X-valued accounts - unexpected value

TP_NM_DK.note: Use for mapping DK types to logic

INT_PRD_TP_CL.description: Interest product type classification - defines the product type for interest calculations
INT_PRD_TP_CL.business_context: Used to categorize accounts by their interest calculation product type

INT_TP_CL.description: Interest type classification - specific interest calculation types (e.g., debit, credit, overdraft rates)
INT_TP_CL.business_context: Defines the specific type of interest calculation applied to accounts

CMPN_TP_CL.description: Campaign type classification - business activities and customer interactions
CMPN_TP_CL.business_context: Tracks different types of business campaigns and customer contact activities

SGNL_TP_CL.description: Signal type classification - alerts and notifications
SGNL_TP_CL.business_context: Categorizes signals/alerts associated with campaigns (warnings, messages)

RSP_TP_CL.description: Response type classification - campaign response tracking
RSP_TP_CL.business_context: Tracks customer responses to campaigns and business activities

CMPN_LCS_TP_CL.description: Campaign lifecycle status type classification - campaign progress tracking
CMPN_LCS_TP_CL.business_context: Tracks the lifecycle status of campaigns (in progress, completed, waiting)

AC_TXN_TP_CL.description: Account transaction type classification - types of account transactions
AC_TXN_TP_CL.business_context: Categorizes transaction types such as card transactions, transfers, fees

gbuc_.meaning: Gebyr på udst. af udl. check

PYMT_TP_CL.business_context: Indicates whether a transaction is a deposit (indbetaling) or withdrawal (udbetaling)

TXN_TP_CL.description: Transaction type classification - accounting transaction types
TXN_TP_CL.business_context: Categorizes general ledger transaction types (journal entries, creditor transactions)

PSTG_TP_CL.description: Posting type classification - GL posting categories
PSTG_TP_CL.business_context: Defines the type of posting to the general ledger (financial journal, creditor balance)

PRFL_RQM_TP_CL.description: Profile requirement type classification - interest profile requirements
PRFL_RQM_TP_CL.business_context: Defines whether interest profiles are mandatory, suggested, locked, or optional

PD_X_PD_TP_CL.description: Product cross-product type classification - product relationships and rules
PD_X_PD_TP_CL.business_context: Defines relationships between products (exclusions, requirements, investments allowed)

AR_X_AR_TP_CL.description: Arrangement cross-arrangement type classification - account relationships
AR_X_AR_TP_CL.business_context: Defines relationships between custody and account arrangements (e.g., where returns are posted)

SVC_ELMT_TP_CL.description: Service element type classification - account service features and add-ons
SVC_ELMT_TP_CL.business_context: Defines optional/mandatory services linked to accounts (statements, overdrafts, payment methods)

SVC_ELMT_RQM_TP_CL.description: Service element requirement type classification - service optionality
SVC_ELMT_RQM_TP_CL.business_context: Defines whether service elements are mandatory, optional, suggested, or locked

ARG_VAL_CL.description: Argument value classification - service element parameters
ARG_VAL_CL.business_context: Parameter codes for service element conditions (print medium, frequency, card usage)

USED_NOTF_UOM_CL.description: Used notification unit of measure classification - notification measurement units

CLC_BASIS_TP_CL.description: Calculation basis type classification - basis for interest/fee calculations
CLC_BASIS_TP_CL.business_context: Defines what balance or amount is used as the basis for calculations

ARS_ADV_TP_CL.description: Arrears/advance type classification - timing of interest/fee accrual
ARS_ADV_TP_CL.business_context: Indicates whether interest is calculated in arrears (bagud) or in advance (forud)

USED_CLC_MTH_TP_CL.description: Used calculation method type classification - method for interest rate changes
USED_CLC_MTH_TP_CL.business_context: Defines how interest rate changes are applied: stepped (trappe) or broken/immediate (knæk)

RATE_RNWL_FRQ_TP_CL.description: Rate renewal frequency type classification - frequency of interest rate reviews
RATE_RNWL_FRQ_TP_CL.business_context: Defines how often fixed/agreed interest rates are renewed or reviewed

CSTD_AR_TP_CL.description: Custody arrangement type classification - custody/depot account types
CSTD_AR_TP_CL.business_context: Categorizes custody accounts by purpose (pension, child savings, general depot)

CSTD_AR_LCS_TP_CL.description: Custody arrangement lifecycle status type classification - custody account status
CSTD_AR_LCS_TP_CL.business_context: Tracks lifecycle status of custody accounts (not established, established, settled in VP)

CSTD_AR_ST_TP_CL.description: Custody arrangement status type classification - active/blocked/deleted status
CSTD_AR_ST_TP_CL.business_context: Indicates operational status of custody accounts (active, blocked, deleted)

IVNT_TP_CL.description: Inventory type classification - types of investment holdings
IVNT_TP_CL.business_context: Categorizes investment inventory positions (accounting holdings, spot transactions, drawn positions)

fffje.meaning: Regnskabsbeholdningen, udtrukne - d.v.s. den udtrukne del af beholdning 01.

BAL_TP_CL.description: Balance type classification - custody balance measure types
BAL_TP_CL.business_context: Defines different balance/value measures for investments (market value, book value, nominal)

ACG_AR_SRC_TP_CL.description: Accounting arrangement source type classification - account origin
ACG_AR_SRC_TP_CL.business_context: Indicates whether GL accounts are system-generated or manually created

ACG_AR_TP_CL.description: Accounting arrangement type classification - GL account types
ACG_AR_TP_CL.business_context: Categorizes general ledger accounts by type (balance sheet, P&L, heading, sum)

ACG_AR_BLC_TP_CL.description: Accounting arrangement balance type classification - balance sheet classification
ACG_AR_BLC_TP_CL.business_context: Indicates balance sheet treatment of GL accounts

CR_TP_CL.description: Correction type classification - posting correction indicator
CR_TP_CL.business_context: Flags whether posting is a correction/reversal entry

PRD_CODE_TP_CL.description: Period code type classification - accounting period types
PRD_CODE_TP_CL.business_context: Indicates timing of posting (normal, opening/primo, closing/ultimo)

OPRL_TAX_TP_CL.description: Operational tax type classification - operational vs special taxation

PST_ENTR_TP_CL.description: Post entry type classification - posting entry characteristics
PST_ENTR_TP_CL.business_context: Flags special characteristics of GL postings

FI_CL_TP_CL.description: Financial information classification type - customer financial activity categories
FI_CL_TP_CL.business_context: Categorizes customer financial information (mobile payments, cash transactions, income types)

ECN_IND_TP_RSN_TP_CL.description: Economic indicator type reason type classification - transaction purpose/reason codes
ECN_IND_TP_RSN_TP_CL.business_context: Captures reasons for transactions (gifts, family transfers, daily consumption, savings)

DLV_DVC_TP_CL.description: Delivery device type classification - delivery channels
DLV_DVC_TP_CL.business_context: Defines channels for delivering banking services or documents

CLRG_TP_CL.description: Clearing type classification - payment clearing methods

al004.name: Closed
al004.usage: Alert has been closed - most common status (91.5%)

ALRT_LVL_TP_CL.notes: Indicates whether alert is at customer or account level

al230.meaning: SDC scenarios - Actual transactions vs. expected customer behavior
al230.name: SDC scenarier - Faktiske transaktioner vs. forventet adfærd for kunde

al229.meaning: SDC scenarios - Actual transactions vs. account statistics
al229.name: SDC scenarier - Faktiske transaktioner vs. statistik for konto

al228.meaning: SDC scenarios - Actual account transactions (simple scenarios)
al228.name: SDC scenarier - Faktiske transaktioner for konto (simple scenarier)

TRGR_LCS_TP_CL.description: AML KYC Trigger Lifecycle Type Classification

NAT_ID_TP.notes: Danish national identification types for persons and organizations

OU_TP.notes: Organizational hierarchy - orgn_ for main entity, orun_ for sub-units

FI_CL_SCM_CL.description: FI Classification Scheme Classification (Case Activity Type)
FI_CL_SCM_CL.notes: Danish case activity names - specific to FKS case management system

WF_TP_ID.notes: No data found in current snapshot - likely populated conditionally

AVY_TP_ID.notes: Numeric IDs for specific workflow activities in Danish

values.usage: Most activities don't have a decision type (100%)

AVY_DCSN_TP_CL.notes: Currently populated with blank values - decision type may be conditional

SGNL_LCS_TP_CL.notes: Lifecycle states for customer signals in FKS system

RSP_TP_CL.notes: Response type for customer signals - mostly unused

OBJTYPEID.notes: Case object types for FKS workflow system - numeric IDs

CASEGROUPNAME.notes: Case groupings for workflow management - mix of Danish and Norwegian terms

STATE.notes: Some STATE values appear to be dates (2019-10-, 2019-07-, etc.) which may be data quality issues

ACTION_ROLENAME.description: Case Action and Role Name combination

Indtast memo | Medarbejder.usage: Enter memo by employee - most common action (17.8%)

AutoProdEstab_Function | RulesEngine.usage: Auto product establishment via rules engine (4.0%)

ACTION_ROLENAME.notes: Actions are paired with roles that perform them - Danish action names

OUTCOME.notes: Case action outcomes - mix of status codes and Danish terms

ENCB_TP_CL.notes: Types of mortgages and encumbrances on real property

RI_X_TP_TP_CL.notes: Currently only property owner type is used
